comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per the digitised newspapers Peacock's jam factory appears to have moved from Petrie Bight to Kangaroo Point in the first half of 1890. Many of the low lying buildings in this stretch of river might not have survived the 1893 flood...per this report the jam factory was a casualty - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article20338740 ; I haven't yet found any newspaper item indicating that the jam factory was rebuilt after the flood...so there's a good chance that this pic was taken between 1890-1893. James Edwards was an 1880s-1890s Brisbane boat builder...he appears to have remained at Kangaroo Point after the 1893 flood The Immigrant Depot was completed in ca. 1887-1888. It was used as a military hospital during WW1 and WW2.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Thank you again for your thorough research quasymody. It is great that we can pinpoint a better date range thanks to you.
